business.headline: India-US Bilateral Trade Agreement: Final Phase Negotiations Aim For ConclusionUnion Minister Piyush Goyal will lead a team to the United States for trade talks. India and the US are working to finalize the Bilateral Trade Agreement (BTA) by early July. The US President has proposed a trade agreement with India that would have no tariffs on a wide range of American products. The US President stated, 'India is one of the highest tariff nations in the world. It's very hard to sell into India.'

Adani drops Chinese lounge partner DragonPass: What it means for Indian flyersThe move, triggered by rising national security concerns, has ended DragonPass's access to Adani-managed airport lounges across the country.

Why the middle class is chasing expensive brands, explains market expertA market expert noted that nearly 75% of luxury spending today comes from the middle class, not due to rising incomes, but because of social media, marketing tricks, and peer pressure that fuel the urge to appear successful.

Indian traders' body boycotts Turkey and Azerbaijan over support for PakistanThe move comes after both Turkey and Azerbaijan openly showed support for Pakistan, at a time when India is facing sensitive national security challenges.

India-US trade deal: First phase likely to be ready by July 1, say sourcesIndia and the United States are in negotiations for a trade deal, with sources indicating that phase one could be ready by July 1st.

India to grow at 6.3%, ahead of China, US, and European Union: UN reportAccording to the UN's mid-year update of the World Economic Situation and Prospects (WESP), India's growth is being fuelled by strong household spending and solid government investments.

Sensex slips 200 points, Nifty holds ground above 25,000; defence stocks surgeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 200.15 points to close at 82,330.59, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 42.30 points to end at 25,019.80.

2 IPOs to open next week: Check Belrise Industries, Borana Weaves detailsWhile Belrise Industries will open for bidding on May 21, investors can bid for the IPO of Borana Weaves starting May 20, 2025.

ITR filing 2025: Is July 31 your tax deadline? Find outFiling your return on time helps avoid penalties and delays in refunds. It also keeps your financial records in order. So, if your deadline is July 31, skip the last-minute rush and file in advance.

ITR filing 2025: Is digital Form 16 a game-changer for salaried taxpayers?Digital Form 16 is an electronic version of the traditional Form 16. It's generated directly from the TRACES portal, which is managed by the Income Tax Department. This means all your salary details, TDS, and tax-saving deductions are recorded accurately and match what the government sees.

Government clears 187 startups for tax relief. Here's what it meansTo qualify, the start-up must be recognised by the Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT). It should be a private limited company or a limited liability partnership and its turnover should not cross Rs 100 crore in any year since incorporation.

What Pakistan can and can't do with IMF loanThe International Monetary Fund (IMF) has approved a fresh loan package for Pakistan, agreeing to release USD 1 billion under its Extended Fund Facility (EFF).

Defence stocks extend rally on possible budget boost. What should investors do?The NSE Nifty India Defence index surged over 5% intraday on Friday. Cochin Shipyard and GRSE have been leading the charge, with the latter gaining a stunning 30% since May 13.

Singtel offloads 1.2% stake in Bharti Airtel in $1.54 billion dealSingtel, which has been an investor in Airtel for over 20 years, said its stake would drop to 28.3%, valued at around S$48 billion, from 29.5% previously.

Blaming NRIs won't solve India's housing problem, says investor. Here's whyNRIs earn in strong currencies like US dollars, pounds, or euros. So when they convert that money to rupees, they can afford much more. A house that seems expensive to someone in India may feel quite reasonable to someone earning abroad.

Cochin Shipyard, GRSE rally up to 12%: Why are these defence stocks rising?Cochin Shipyard jumped 12.51% to Rs 2,039 on the BSE at around 11:47 am, extending its rally for a sixth straight session. GRSE climbed 11.10% intraday to Rs 2,510, taking its cumulative gains to over 30% since announcing results post-market on May 13.

Stop all bookings to America, warns ace investor as Indians ditch TurkeyTourism to Turkey and Azerbaijan has already taken a major hit, especially after reports that Pakistan used Turkish-made drones in its recent strikes.

Borana Weaves IPO to open May 20: Check GMP, expected listing gainsAccording to grey market trends, the IPO is commanding a premium of Rs 55 per share, suggesting potential listing gains of over 25% for successful applicants.

Apple assures India manufacturing plans intact despite Trump remarks: ReportWhile Apple has not issued a public statement, sources said the company reaffirmed to Indian officials that India remains a key part of its global supply chain.

Explained: Why Yes Bank shares are in focus todayYes Bank stock: The shares fell over 1% in early trade but later recovered to trade in the green. At the start of the day, Yes Bank shares opened at Rs 21.50, slightly below Thursday's close of Rs 21.51.

Pakistan offers zero-tariff bilateral trade deal to US: ReportThe development comes shortly after US President Donald Trump claimed credit for brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan, following four days of intense cross-border hostilities involving drones and missile strikes.
Explained: Why Bharti Airtel shares fell 3% in early trade today At 9:35 am, shares of Bharti Airtel were trading 2.69% lower at Rs 1,816.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

IndusInd bank shares down 2% after private lender flags interest mistakeIndusInd bank stock opened at Rs 735.95 after having closed at Rs 780.30 in the previous session. The shares have lost 7.29% in the past 5 days, 23.55% over the last 6 months, and 45.48% over the past year.
Sensex, Nifty open lower after yesterday's rally; IndusInd Bank down 3%The BSE Sensex was down 226.18 points to 82,304.56 at 9:20 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 67.80 points to trade at 24,994.30.

Stock market today: Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher. Here's whyBoth the Sensex and Nifty touched their highest levels in the last seven months in the last session. So far this week, the Nifty has gained around 4.5% and the BSE Sensex about 4%.
Stocks to watch on May 16: Hyundai, Airtel, IndusInd Bank, BHEL, Bajaj AutoHyundai Motor, BHEL, Delhivery, Emami will announce their earnings for the January-March quarter on Friday.

IndusInd Bank flags Rs 674 crore error as 'incorrectly recorded interest'The bank said its Internal Audit Department (IAD) found that a total of Rs 674 crore was wrongly shown as interest over three quarters in FY 2024-25.
India offered zero-tariff trade deal: Donald TrumpUS President Donald Trump claimed that India has offered the United States a trade deal with "literally zero tariffs".

YES Bank shares jump 21% in 5 days. What investors need to knowSMBC, a part of the Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group (SMFG), plans to buy the 20% stake from State Bank of India (SBI) and seven private banks, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Axis Bank, IDFC First Bank, Federal Bank, and Bandhan Bank.

Sensex ends 1,200 points higher, Nifty above 25,000; Tata Motors surges 4%The S&P BSE Sensex surged 1,200.18 points to end at 82,530.74, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 395.60 points to close at 25,062.10.

Donald Trump claims India has offered zero-tariff deal in trade talksSpeaking at a business forum in Qatar, Trump said, "India has offered us a deal where basically they are willing to literally charge us no tariff." He didn't provide further details, and there was no immediate response from the Indian government.

Planning a personal loan? 7 hidden charges you must know aboutMany people only look at the interest rate when taking a personal loan. But there are several other costs that can add up. Knowing these charges helps you plan better, avoid surprises, and even negotiate some of them with the bank.

Sensex jumps 1,300 points: Why is stock market rising today?As of 2:38 p.m., the S&P BSE Sensex had gained 1,217.88 points to reach 82,548.44, and the NSE Nifty50 had climbed 410.57 points to 25,077.50.

FDs vs PPF: Which investment option should you choose and why?By investing in PPF, you can claim a tax exemption of up to Rs 1.5 lakh under Section 80C in a financial year, under the old tax regime. Moreover, the interest you earn from a PPF account is also tax-free. FDs, however, do not offer any tax deduction unless it's a 5-year tax-saving FD.

Don't want you building in India, Trump tells Apple CEO Tim CookTrump's remarks came just days after India threatened to impose retaliatory tariffs on the US. This was in response to the US raising duties on Indian steel and aluminium exports.

Mutual funds load up on IT, cut FMCG and telecom stakes in April: ReportKotak Mahindra Bank attracted the highest MF investment in the financial sector, with Rs 1,586 crore. IDFC First Bank and HDFC Bank followed, drawing Rs 1,150 crore and Rs 1,026 crore.

Tata Motors shares rise 4% today. Here's whyThe rise in Tata Motors' share price comes even after the company reported a 51% fall in its consolidated net profit to Rs 8,470 crore for the quarter ending March 2025.

Travel sites see spike in Turkey, Azerbaijan cancellations over Pakistan supportBoycott calls grow as Turkey and Azerbaijan back Pakistan. Travel sites like MakeMyTrip and ixigo report major cancellations and suspended bookings to these destinations.

Raymond shares jump 5%. Why stock hit upper circuit today?At the Bombay Stock Exchange, Raymond shares were locked at Rs 578.70 in early trade, up 4.99%. The buying comes a day after the stock appeared to lose more than 60% of its value, a fall that was not driven by weak fundamentals or selling pressure but by a mechanical price adjustment.

Rs 87,000 profit on listing? This IPO's GMP suggests bonanza for investorsVirtual Galaxy Infotech IPO: The IPO received a strong response from all categories of investors as it was subscribed 231.45 times overall.

entertainment.headline: How Lady Superstar Nayanthara rose above controversies and ruled Tamil cinemaFrom her legal battle with Dhanush to facing online trolls after the birth of her twin boys, Nayanthara has navigated a range of controversies throughout her career. Here is an overview of some of these challenges and how the Lady Superstar managed them—all while steadily rising to fame.

Nayanthara joins Chiranjeevi's 157th film with Anil Ravipudi, announcement video outIt's official! Nayanthara has been roped in for megastar Chiranjeevi's next film, tentatively titled 'Mega157'. Set for a Sankranthi 2026 release, it is directed by Anil Ravipudi.

Guns N' Roses Mumbai performance: The rock revival we've all been waiting forGuns N' Roses is set to electrify Mumbai with their iconic rock energy on May 17 at the Mahalaxmi Race Course. This concert promises to be a legendary celebration of timeless anthems and unforgettable performances.

Kristen Stewart's directorial debut impresses Cannes with four-minute ovationKristen Stewart made her directorial debut with 'The Chronology of Water'. The film received appreciation at the ongoing Cannes Film Festival.

Beyond beauty, beneath pain: Why filmmakers keep returning to a wounded Kashmir?What is it about Kashmir that keeps attracting cinema? Why do filmmakers keep going back to the Valley despite its turbulent past? It certainly can't be all about beauty. It is more. On Cinematic Saturday, we spoke to the actors and directors who have shot in Kashmir, to understand why Kashmir is for cinema.

Joaquin Phoenix in tears as Eddington gets five-minute standing ovation at Cannes'Eddington', starring Joaquin Phoenix, Emma Stone, Pedro Pascal and Austin Butler, received thunderous applause at the 78th Cannes Film Festival. In clips that were shared online, Phoenix is seen visibly moved by the response.

Black, White and Gray creator says show is about us, not about its charactersSony LIV's crime thriller 'Black White and Gray - Love Kills' broke new ground with its unique mockumentary style, offering a compelling narrative that explores the complexities of human nature. The show challenged viewers to rethink their perceptions of truth and bias, delivering a culturally rooted story that resonates deeply with Indian audiences.

Mission Impossible 8 review: Tom Cruise vs AI battle, guess who wins?Released-Sat May 17, 2025Tom Cruise once again dazzles with breathtaking stunts and nostalgia in 'Mission Impossible: The Final Reckoning', proving his unmatched dedication to action cinema. Despite some narrative flaws, the film stands out for its thrilling sequences and Cruise's charisma, even at 62.

It's Okay to Not be Okay to Doctor Slump: Evolution of mental health portrayalK-dramas have evolved significantly in portraying mental health, moving from stigma and stereotypes to nuanced and empathetic storytelling. These dramas now highlight real struggles like trauma, anxiety, and burnout, encouraging open conversations about mental well-being.

Kunal Kohli says Saif did Hum Tum after 3 top stars rejected the classicDirector Kunal Kohli revealed that 'Hum Tum' was originally offered to Hrithik Roshan, Aamir Khan, and Vivek Oberoi before Saif Ali Khan landed the role. The iconic romantic comedy re-released in theatres on May 16.

Parul Gulati reacts to claims that Indian actors 'pay' to be at CannesActor Parul Gulati reacted to Cannes banning 'naked' dressing as she is set to make her debut at the prestigious festival. The actor stated that she did not want to feel pressured by it.
Ironheart trailer: Riri Williams takes forward Tony Stark's Iron Man legacyRiri Williams, played by Dominique Thorne, takes forward Iron Man's legacy in the MCU's 'Ironheart' as a genius inventor.

Rani Mukerji as Suhana Khan's mother in Shah Rukh Khan-Deepika's King: ReportRani Mukerji is set to reunite with Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone in Siddharth Anand's upcoming action-thriller 'King', playing a pivotal cameo role. The film begins shooting this month and is slated for a late 2026 release.

Justin Bieber's team addresses rumours of being Sean Diddy's assault victimJustin Bieber's team recently addressed rumours about being sexually assaulted by Sean 'Diddy' Combs.  They mentioned how 'nothing untoward' happened between them.

Pawan Kalyan's Hari Hara Veera Mallu gets release date after multiple delaysAfter several delays, Pawan Kalyan's long-anticipated historical action film, 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu: Part 1 – Sword vs Spirit', is finally gearing up for release on June 12.

Singer Amaal Mallik's family is 'closer, happier' after his decision to break tiesMusic composer Amaal Mallik recently opened up about his battle with depression and the emotional post where he distanced himself from his family. The singer shared that while it initially hurt, his distance has brought his family closer together.

Anaganaga review: A decent film about life beyond marksReleased-Fri May 16, 2025Anaganaga movie review: This Telugu drama film, starring Sumanth in the lead, keeps a mirror in front of the present education system, and hits the right emotional chords to shine light on the problem and the solution.

Vikrant Massey in Karan Johar's Dostana 2 after Kartik Aaryan's exit: ReportVikrant Massey is rumoured to be replacing Kartik Aaryan in Karan Johar's much-delayed Dostana 2, which is expected to begin shooting in January 2026. The film will also star Lakshya and introduce a fresh female lead.

BTS' Jin shares heartbreak anthem Don't Say You Love Me from album EchoBTS's Jin dropped the new music video for the title track, 'Don't Say You Love Me', featuring actor Shin Se-kyung. The song is a part of his album, 'Echo'.

general news.headline: Shashi Tharoor among 7 MPs named for vital role in Operation Sindoor outreachSenior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor will lead one of the seven all-party delegations of MPs tasked with briefing key foreign governments on the recent India-Pakistan conflict.

Haryana-based YouTuber among 6 arrested for spying for PakistanHaryana-based YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra and five others have been arrested for sharing sensitive information with Pakistani intelligence operatives.

Rift out in open? Centre snubs Congress picks, names Shashi Tharoor for key roleShashi Tharoor was among the seven MPs named by the Centre to lead an all-party delegation to expose Pakistan-sponsored terrorism. However, Tharoor's name was not recommended by the Congress.
13 Delhi councillors resign from AAP, announce formation of new partyThe rebel AAP councillors, under the leadership of Mukesh Goel, announced a new party called Indraprastha Vikas Party.

Beyond beauty, beneath pain: Why filmmakers keep returning to a wounded Kashmir?What is it about Kashmir that keeps attracting cinema? Why do filmmakers keep going back to the Valley despite its turbulent past? It certainly can't be all about beauty. It is more. On Cinematic Saturday, we spoke to the actors and directors who have shot in Kashmir, to understand why Kashmir is for cinema.

Trump's own 'Big Boss'? US plans reality show for immigrants to get citizenshipThe US Homeland Security is considering a TV show where immigrants will be made to go through a series of challenges to compete for US citizenship.

ED raids Gujarat Samachar's Mumbai premises day after action against co-ownerMumbai premises linked to Gujarat Samachar were raided on Saturday, a day after the newspaper's co-owner was arrested and granted bail in a money laundering case.

Beneath the blue: India's Samudrayaan dives into the unknownThe vast open seas harbour some of the most pristine, untouched environments and precious resources that remain hidden from the clutches of man.

Mission Impossible 8 review: Tom Cruise vs AI battle, guess who wins?Released-Sat May 17, 2025Tom Cruise once again dazzles with breathtaking stunts and nostalgia in 'Mission Impossible: The Final Reckoning', proving his unmatched dedication to action cinema. Despite some narrative flaws, the film stands out for its thrilling sequences and Cruise's charisma, even at 62.
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

Self-goal? Telangana MLA says other ministers often take bribes to clear filesA video of Telangana Forest Minister Konda Surekha's speech has gone viral on social media, with the opposition Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) demanding an investigation.

Shashi Tharoor in India's global outreach mission: Why it makes senseCongress leader Shashi Tharoor has been picked for India's Operation Sindoor global outreach mission and so has AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi. A few days prior, India Today commentator Kamlesh Kishore Singh had mooted the very same idea, highlighting the Kerala MP's diplomatic and linguistic prowess that can cripple Pakistan's post-operation illusion. Tharoor's gravitas and Owaisi's firepower could prove to be India's best shot at reclaiming the global narrative, he had argued. We are re-offering the full article in the context of the latest development.

Suzuki Access Ride Connect TFT Edition launched at Rs 1,01,900Suzuki has launched the new Access Ride Connect TFT Edition, featuring a Bluetooth-enabled TFT display, refreshed colour options, and the same 125cc OBD2-compliant engine.

Rescuers say 100 killed in Israel's fresh Gaza offensive 'Gideon Chariots'Israel launched a new offensive in Gaza, dubbed Operation Gideon Chariots, with reports of 100 likely killed. The strikes come amid rising international pressure over the humanitarian crisis.

Caught on camera: Bengaluru techie killed in hit-and-run over cigarette disputeA man in a Hyundai Creta followed the software engineer duo and deliberately rammed his vehicle into their motorcycle after they allegedly refused to give him a cigarette. One was killed, and his friend remains in critical condition.

Asim Munir woke me up at 2.30 am: Pak PM confirms India strikes on key airbasesIndia conducted precision strikes on Pakistani military sites, including Nur Khan Air Base, on May 10 as part of Operation Sindoor. The strikes were in retaliation to the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack, in which 26 people were killed.

Joaquin Phoenix in tears as Eddington gets five-minute standing ovation at Cannes'Eddington', starring Joaquin Phoenix, Emma Stone, Pedro Pascal and Austin Butler, received thunderous applause at the 78th Cannes Film Festival. In clips that were shared online, Phoenix is seen visibly moved by the response.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Shashi Tharoor may lead India's Op Sindoor outreach to US, Owaisi also namedCongress leader Shashi Tharoor is expected to lead an all-party delegation to the US to brief the Trump administration on India's military tensions with Pakistan and its regional security position.

Wait, did Parul Gulati wear a braided-hair dress to Cannes red carpet?In a conceptual tribute to her wig and hair extension brand Nish Hair, Parul Gulati wore a braided-hair dress for her red debut at the Cannes Film Festival.
Uber driver pulled gun on passengers after row over directions. Video goes viralMiami-based rapper Krissy Celess shared a video of herself being threatened at gunpoint by an Uber driver.

Relief, then fire: Neeraj Chopra's 90m mark breakthrough lights a fresh fuseAfter years of near misses, Neeraj Chopra finally broke the elusive 90-metre barrier in the Doha Diamond League on Friday, marking a historic milestone. Yet, with fierce rivals rising, this breakthrough signals just the beginning of a new, fiercer battle ahead.

Security forces launch search ops in J&K after intel on presence of terroristsSecurity forces have launched search operations in multiple Jammu and Kashmir districts after the input of the movement of three suspected terrorists in Samba.

Himachal Pradesh Board declares Class 12 result. Here's how to check scoresHPBOSE 12th Result 2025: Here's how to check scoresThe Himachal Pradesh Board of School Education (HPBOSE) has declared the Class 12 Result 2025 today. Students can now access their scores for all streams on the official website, hpbose.org.

sports.headline: What happens if the RCB vs KKR clash gets washed off due to rain?IPL 2025: Both Kolkata Knight Riders and Royal Challengers Bengaluru will be affected if Saturday's match at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru gets called off due to rain.

RCB vs KKR: Live weather updates from Chinnaswamy StadiumRCB vs KKR, IPL 2025, Bengaluru weather live updates: As cricket fans gear up for the resumption of IPL, the wait has high chances of getting delayed with persistent rainfall in Bengaluru, that has sparked serious concerns over whether the highly anticipated fixture will go ahead as planned — or at least, without interruption.

Sinner vs Alcaraz: All you need to know about Italian Open 2025 finalItalian Open 2025: Jannik Sinner beat Tommy Paul on Saturday to set up a clash with four-time Grand Slam champion Carlos Alcaraz on Sunday, May 18.

Ruben Amorim says United's Chelsea loss will help him pick Europa Final XIRuben Amorim drew positives from Manchester United's Premier League loss to Chelsea, revealing that the performance helped him shape ideas for the starting XI in their high-stakes Europa League final against Tottenham Hotspur.
Praggnanandhaa wins Superbet Classic after a tough tiebreakR Praggnanandhaa clinched his maiden title on the Grand Chess Tour by outplaying France's Maxime Vachier-Lagrave in the Superbet Classic.

UAE vs Bangladesh T20I series: Squads, schedule and all you knowLitton Das' Bangladesh and Muhammad Waseem's United Arab Emirates (UAE) will be up against each other in a two-match T20I series at the Sharjah Cricket Stadium.

Suryakumar Yadav pens heartfelt tribute to Rohit Sharma on Wankhede honourSuryakumar Yadav shared a heartfelt tribute to ODI skipper Rohit Sharma after the Wankhede Stadium named a stand in his honour, celebrating the Mumbai legend's legacy and achievements in the presence of dignitaries and family.

IPL 2025 playoffs scenarios explained: What each team needs to do to qualifyThe race for the playoffs is heating up as IPL 2025 resumes following a one-week break due to India-Pakistan tensions. With 13 league games remaining, seven of the 10 teams remain mathematically in contention for a playoff spot. Former champions Chennai Super Kings, Rajasthan Royals, and Sunrisers Hyderabad have been eliminated from the race.

Shubman, Shreyas or Pant? Sunil Gavaskar picks his next India captainFormer batter Sunil Gavaskar reckoned that Shubman Gill is the most apt choice as the Indian Test captain after Rohit Sharma bid goodbye to the purest format earlier this month.

Roston Chase replaces Kraigg Brathwaite as new West Indies Test captainRoston Chase has been named the new West Indies Test captain, stepping into the role after Kraigg Brathwaite's resignation, as the team prepares to host Australia in their opening World Test Championship series.

Spectacular feat, India is proud: PM praises Neeraj Chopra after 90.23 metres throwPrime Minister Narendra Modi praised Neeraj Chopra's historic 90.23m throw at the Doha Diamond League, celebrating his first-ever 90-meter milestone and applauding his dedication to this historic feat.

Jannik Sinner sets up blockbuster Carlos Alcaraz final after huge scare in semisItalian Open 2025: Jannik Sinner is set to face Carlos Alcaraz after beating Tommy Paul in the semi-final. Sinner became the first Italian to play in the Rome final since 1978.

'Mentally stronger' Sneh Rana eyes World Cup after record-breaking returnIn an exclusive chat with India Today Digital, Sneh Rana spoke about her incredible ODI comeback in the Sri Lanka tri-nation series where she picked up 15 wickets and won the Player of the Series award. On Thursday, Rana also found her way back into India's T20I team for the tour of England.

Chinnaswamy awaits Virat Kohli magic in first match after Test retirementIPL 2025, RCB vs KKR: Royal Challengers Bengaluru have a great chance of becoming the first team to qualify for the playoffs when they meet Kolkata Knight Riders on May 17 at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium.

India's burden has reduced: Neeraj Chopra on breaching 90m markNeeraj Chopra threw a personal best of 90.23m at the Doha Diamond League, breaking the 90m barrier. Neeraj said that the monkey was off the shoulders for many Indian fans who thought that he would not be able to breach the 90m mark.

In stats: Neeraj Chopra becomes 25th man to join elite 90m club in javelinNeeraj Chopra finally breached the elusive 90m barrier with a throw of 90.23m, becoming the 25th athlete in the world — and only the third Asian — to achieve the feat in the men's javelin throw.

Parul Chaudhary betters steeplechase national record, qualifies for World ChampionshipIndian steeplechaser Parul Chaudhary made a powerful start to her 2025 season, smashing her own national record in the women's 3000m steeplechase with a time of 9:13.39 at the Doha Diamond League on Friday

Watch: Neeraj Chopra's subdued celebration after historic 90.23 metres throwNeeraj Chopra became the first Indian to cross the 90m mark in men's javelin with a 90.23m throw at the 2025 Doha Diamond League. This milestone ends years of pressure and sets a new benchmark despite a narrow defeat to Julian Weber.

KKR has nothing much to lose from here: Manish Pandey ahead of RCB clashKKR batter Manish Pandey has said that the team has nothing much to lose now in the IPL 2025 season and will be aiming for a strong finish to the campaign. KKR will face RCB on May 17 as the IPL campaign restarts.

Neeraj Chopra throws record 90.23m, but finishes 2nd in Doha Diamond LeagueNeeraj Chopra finished in second place in the 2025 Doha Diamond League Men's Javelin Throw event on Friday (May 16), despite a record-breaking 90.23-meter throw, as Germany's Julian Weber startled everyone with a final throw of 91.06 meters.

Neeraj Chopra throws 90.23m: Fans celebrate historic feat of India's best athleteFans erupted in celebration on Friday night as Neeraj Chopra finally breached the elusive 90-metre barrier, recording a mammoth throw of 90.23m at the 2025 Doha Diamond League.

Neeraj breaches 90m mark for 1st time, throws 90.23m in Doha Diamond LeagueNeeraj Chopra was able to finally breach the 90-metre mark for the first time in his career during the Doha Diamond League 2025 on Friday, May 16. Neeraj hit a perfect throw of 90.23m to become the first Indian to go past the mark.

Carlos Alcaraz fights past Musetti to reach Italian Open finalCarlos Alcaraz moved one step closer to a dream showdown with World No. 1 Jannik Sinner at the Italian Open, overcoming a spirited challenge from local favourite Lorenzo Musetti with a composed 6-3, 7-6(4) victory in Friday's semifinal.

Virat Kohli's white jersey tribute from RCB: Director Mo Bobat respondsRCB director of cricket Mo Bobat commented on the tribute planned by the fans for Virat Kohli after the star batter announced his retirement from Test cricket. The RCB fans are planning to wear white jerseys during the clash against KKR on May 17.

Smack one there! Ravi Shastri's message to Rohit Sharma after stand unveilingRavi Shastri gave Rohit Sharma a hilarious message after the stand named after him was unveiled at the Wankhede stadium on Friday, May 16. Rohit was immortalised at the iconic ground for his contributions to Indian cricket.

Shubman Gill picked for India A tour England amid Test captaincy rumoursShubman Gill, rumoured to be the captain of the Indian Test team after Rohit Sharma, will play in India A squad matches ahead of the England Test series. Shubman will join the side for the second tour game.

Doha DL Highlights: Julian Weber stuns Neeraj Chopra with final throwNeeraj Chopra in Doha Diamond League, Highlights: Neeraj Chopra has been stunned by Julian Weber's final throw at the Doha Diamond League. Weber puts in a mega throw of 91.06m, which upstages Neeraj's career best throw of 90.23m. Neeraj breaks the 90m mark, but finishes 2nd in the competition.

Karun Nair rewarded with India A call up in squad for England tourThe All-India Senior Selection Committee has announced a 15-member India A squad for the upcoming red-ball tour of England. Abhimanyu Easwaran will lead the side in two first-class matches.

Virat Kohli's Test shirt sales skyrocket, as fans prepare special tributeVirat Kohli's Test cricket retirement sparked a fan campaign to wear his iconic No. 18 jersey at the IPL match. The sale of batter's jerseys have skyrocketed in the streets of Bengaluru.

Rohit Sharma emotional as parents unveil Wankhede stand in his nameSenior India batter Rohit Sharma said it would be a "special feeling" to play in the India jersey during the ODIs at the Wankhede Stadium, where a stand was named after him on Friday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
